column4: mythtv can do some amazing things. :) its a complex and powerfull system
clarify what youmean by 'raw' video.
as in I record some footage from a camera and then just send that video prob maybe encode to h264 to server
'send that video'  ? You mean copy from a camcorder to HD? mythtv wouldent be involved in that..  If you were recording a video Input  or somthing from a tv card.. well then mythtv can help.
yeah... i don't actually need the tv part of mythtv,
then you basically need some sort of video 'server' im guessing.
exactly, and I wasn't sure if mythtv was appropriate or if it was too far away from what I needed to really be applicable
how are the network web cams sending the info?  They special network enabled cams that have a web interface or what exactly?
the cams will be sending streams (udp, rtsp, rtp)
VLC should be able to capture it then. or perhaps streamtuner/streamripper
been wanting to get one of those for the wife. for a security camera for the front porch. :0 but too much $$$ for her.
have you ever looked into zoneminder?
just looked at the store yesterday at a few of them.
do you know how to see if ubuntu can see my com ports?
serial ports?  See if theres a /dev/ttyS* for them
the remote desktop feaute of ubuntu uses 'vnc' as its protocal. any vnc client can connect to it.
but over the internet.. im not sure thats secure.
what do you mean by not secure?
vnc is not very 'secure' over the internet. its mainly for lan use.
you could ssh to their box. if its set up.
it's not :(
